name: Queens Community Board 12
request: Repair or construct new curbs or pedestrian ramps
description: Install curbs. Install curbs at the following location 117th Ave from 195th Street to Linden Blvd, 190th Street from 118th Ave to 120 Ave
site1: Yes, this request is for a street segment
agyresponse: Sidewalks are the responsibility of the adjacent property owner.
agyresponsecat: 03 - The agency agrees with this request, but funding cannot be determined at this time
additionalcomment: Sidewalks are the responsibility of the adjacent property owners. DOT is working in coordination with DEP to address ponding and drainage issues throughout Community Board 12. Curb repair may be included but exact locations are yet to be determined.

name: Queens Community Board 8
description: This property owned by NYCDOT has not been maintained and is an eyesore. We request that it be restored to present a respectful appearance that can be maintained.
site1: Yes, this request is for a street segment
agyresponse: Capital funding constraints, project capacity and City-wide priorities preclude this project at this time.
agyresponsecat: 03 - The agency agrees with this request, but funding cannot be determined at this time
additionalcomment: The Capital Program Management Unit is assessing the best approach for the City to take. The agency supports this request, but it is not an agency priority at this time.

name: Brooklyn Community Board 7
description: Establish a design and reconstruction contract for the 20th Street - McDonald Avenue truck route between 4th Avenue and Caton Avenue to make the entire corridor safer for pedestrians, bicyclists and cars/trucks
site1: Yes, this request is for a street segment
agyresponse: Further study by the agency of this request is needed.
additionalcomment: This study is expected to be concluded and presented to the CB in 2018.
